thread.title: Massive increase in Great Western Main Line cost | Meridian
thread.title_full: Massive increase in Great Western Main Line cost | Meridian - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Massive increase in Great Western Main Line cost | Meridian
text:
The cost of electrifying the line has almost tripled Credit: ITV It's emerged that the cost of electrifying the Great Western Main Line between London, Reading, Oxford and Newbury is now £2.8bn. The cost has almost tripled since the first estimates put the cost of upgrading the route at £874m.
The project timescales have also disintegrated, and the Department for Transport has openly admitted that the earlier deadline of 2018 can no longer be counted on.
The latest revelations came as the House of Commons Public Accounts Committee took evidence from Network Rail chief executive Mark Carne, DfT permanent secretary Philip Rutnam and the chief executive of the Office of Rail and Road, Richard Price.
Last updated Fri 23 Oct 2015 Travel First Great Western
